title: Harris vs Trump Debate: Who is Philippe Reines? Meet Clinton aide playing mock Donald Trump
content: Having worked for Clinton for 17 years, Reines was a senior adviser when she became secretary of state and was deeply involved in her second presidential campaign, where he emerged as her Trump impersonator. About three weeks before Clinton’s first debate with Trump in 2016, Reines joined a team of advisers to help her prepare. He noted that he didn’t simply stand around shouting “crooked Hillary!” or repeating “email email email!” since that would not have been productive.
summary: Having worked for Clinton for 17 years, Reines was a senior adviser when she became secretary of state and was deeply involved in her second presidential campaign, where he emerged as her Trump impersonator. About three weeks before Clinton’s first debate with Trump in 2016, Reines joined a team of advisers to help her prepare. He noted that he didn’t simply stand around shouting “crooked Hillary!” or repeating “email email email!” since that would not have been productive.

title: Ron Howard made movie on JD Vance's Hillbilly Elegy but won't vote for him and Trump
content: Ron Howard, director of Hillbilly Elegy, said when he met JD Vance for the movie based on his bestseller, they did not speak about politics but still JD came across as a moderate thinker but now Howard is surprised and disappointed by JD Vance's statements surfacing from the past. Howard said JD Vance is a changed person now.
summary: Ron Howard, director of Hillbilly Elegy, said when he met JD Vance for the movie based on his bestseller, they did not speak about politics but still JD came across as a moderate thinker but now Howard is surprised and disappointed by JD Vance's statements surfacing from the past. Howard said JD Vance is a changed person now.

title: Crumb the chonky cat: 17kg cat who 'couldn't even walk' after cookie and soup diet rescued from Russian hospital
content: Kroshik, also known as Crumbs, was found in a Russian hospital basement weighing an unhealthy 17kg due to excessive feeding by staff. Now at Matroskin Shelter, he is on a strict diet and exercise plan to shed the extra weight. His case underscores the health risks associated with overfeeding pets.
summary: Kroshik, also known as Crumbs, was found in a Russian hospital basement weighing an unhealthy 17kg due to excessive feeding by staff. Now at Matroskin Shelter, he is on a strict diet and exercise plan to shed the extra weight. His case underscores the health risks associated with overfeeding pets.

title: El Salvador police chief killed in helicopter crash
content: El Salvador’s police chief, Mauricio Arriaza Chicas, was killed in a helicopter crash along with several others. The incident happened in Pasaquina, and President Nayib Bukele has requested international aid for a thorough investigation. Arriaza Chicas had been pivotal in the country's anti-gang campaign since March 2022, contributing significantly to national security.
summary: El Salvador’s police chief, Mauricio Arriaza Chicas, was killed in a helicopter crash along with several others. The incident happened in Pasaquina, and President Nayib Bukele has requested international aid for a thorough investigation. Arriaza Chicas had been pivotal in the country's anti-gang campaign since March 2022, contributing significantly to national security.

title: A roadside bomb hits a vehicle carrying police guarding an anti-polio drive in Pakistan, wounding 9
content: A roadside bomb struck a vehicle carrying officers assigned to protect health workers during a polio immunization drive in South Waziristan, Pakistan, injuring six officers and three civilians. The attack happened as Pakistan launched an initiative to vaccinate 30 million children against polio. Anti-polio campaigns often face violence from militants.
summary: A roadside bomb struck a vehicle carrying officers assigned to protect health workers during a polio immunization drive in South Waziristan, Pakistan, injuring six officers and three civilians. The attack happened as Pakistan launched an initiative to vaccinate 30 million children against polio. Anti-polio campaigns often face violence from militants.

title: September’s full harvest moon: What to expect, viewing tips, and best places to watch
content: The Full Harvest Moon on September 17 promises an extraordinary celestial event with both a supermoon and a partial lunar eclipse. This spectacle will be visible across various regions including North America and Europe. The peak of the eclipse will occur at 10:44pm EDT for observers in the Eastern US time zone.
summary: The Full Harvest Moon on September 17 promises an extraordinary celestial event with both a supermoon and a partial lunar eclipse. This spectacle will be visible across various regions including North America and Europe. The peak of the eclipse will occur at 10:44pm EDT for observers in the Eastern US time zone.

title: Harris vs Trump: 'Restrained' by Biden's rules? Team Kamala worried ahead of debate
content: Kamala Harris is revising her debate strategy following new rules that mute candidates' microphones during their opponent's speaking time. This change affects her initial plan to confront Donald Trump directly. The debate will occur on Tuesday at the National Constitution Center, moderated by ABC News anchors David Muir and Linsey Davis.
summary: Kamala Harris is revising her debate strategy following new rules that mute candidates' microphones during their opponent's speaking time. This change affects her initial plan to confront Donald Trump directly. The debate will occur on Tuesday at the National Constitution Center, moderated by ABC News anchors David Muir and Linsey Davis.

title: 48 killed in fuel tanker collision in Nigeria
content: A tragic collision between a fuel tanker and another truck in Nigeria's Niger state led to an explosion, killing at least 48 people and burning alive 50 cattle. Search and rescue efforts are ongoing. The state's governor has called for calm among residents and emphasized the importance of adhering to road traffic regulations for safety.
summary: A tragic collision between a fuel tanker and another truck in Nigeria's Niger state led to an explosion, killing at least 48 people and burning alive 50 cattle. Search and rescue efforts are ongoing. The state's governor has called for calm among residents and emphasized the importance of adhering to road traffic regulations for safety.

title: UN rights chief warns world risks 'dystopian future'
content: UN rights chief Volker Turk warned that the world needs to change its current path to avoid a future filled with military escalation, repression, disinformation, inequality, and climate change. Speaking at the UN Human Rights Council in Geneva, he urged voters to focus on human rights issues in elections and be cautious of simplistic solutions.
summary: UN rights chief Volker Turk warned that the world needs to change its current path to avoid a future filled with military escalation, repression, disinformation, inequality, and climate change. Speaking at the UN Human Rights Council in Geneva, he urged voters to focus on human rights issues in elections and be cautious of simplistic solutions.

title: Grandfather of Georgia school shooter blames father for massacre: ‘He deserves death penalty’
content: Charles Polhamus calls for the death penalty for his ex-son-in-law, Colin Gray, after the Apalachee High School massacre. Colt Gray, 14, faces four counts of murder. Colin Gray is charged with manslaughter and child cruelty for allegedly being an accessory and providing the weapon used in the attack.
summary: Charles Polhamus calls for the death penalty for his ex-son-in-law, Colin Gray, after the Apalachee High School massacre. Colt Gray, 14, faces four counts of murder. Colin Gray is charged with manslaughter and child cruelty for allegedly being an accessory and providing the weapon used in the attack.

title: Meghan Markle and Prince Harry’s Christmas return to UK: Duchess to defy previous vow?
content: The Duke and Duchess of Sussex are considering returning to the UK for Christmas with their children. They have an invitation from Harry’s uncle, Charles Spencer, to celebrate at Althorp. Although no invitation to Sandringham has been extended yet, they might prefer a quieter celebration at Althorp instead of the royal family's traditional gathering.
summary: The Duke and Duchess of Sussex are considering returning to the UK for Christmas with their children. They have an invitation from Harry’s uncle, Charles Spencer, to celebrate at Althorp. Although no invitation to Sandringham has been extended yet, they might prefer a quieter celebration at Althorp instead of the royal family's traditional gathering.

title: Melania Trump’s rare public statement hits Biden-Harris administration ahead of debate: ‘Efforts to silence my husband’
content: Former First Lady Melania Trump criticizes the Biden administration in a promotional video for her memoir, citing inflation and global conflicts. She discusses free speech concerns and her husband's legal issues. Her book, 'Melania,' seeks to correct misrepresentations and is available for preorder at $40, with an October 8 release date.
summary: Former First Lady Melania Trump criticizes the Biden administration in a promotional video for her memoir, citing inflation and global conflicts. She discusses free speech concerns and her husband's legal issues. Her book, 'Melania,' seeks to correct misrepresentations and is available for preorder at $40, with an October 8 release date.

title: Sexism concerns overshadow record-breaking Chinese video game 'Black Myth: Wukong'
content: The action-adventure game "Black Myth: Wukong" is at the center of a debate over sexism in China's gaming industry. Developer Game Science faced backlash for inappropriate online content from its founder. Despite this controversy, the game has broken records and is seen as a point of national pride in China.
summary: The action-adventure game "Black Myth: Wukong" is at the center of a debate over sexism in China's gaming industry. Developer Game Science faced backlash for inappropriate online content from its founder. Despite this controversy, the game has broken records and is seen as a point of national pride in China.

title: Andrew Tate’s disturbing messages surface as victims describe severe abuse stories: ‘I love raping you ... ’
content: Two British women have accused social media influencer Andrew Tate of rape and sexual violence, with incidents dating back to 2013. These revelations come amid ongoing legal troubles for Tate and his brother Tristan in Romania, where they face charges of human trafficking and rape. Both brothers deny the allegations.
summary: Two British women have accused social media influencer Andrew Tate of rape and sexual violence, with incidents dating back to 2013. These revelations come amid ongoing legal troubles for Tate and his brother Tristan in Romania, where they face charges of human trafficking and rape. Both brothers deny the allegations.

title: Nasa’s Apophis alert: 'God of Chaos' nears Earth again? Everything we know about this ‘peanut-shaped’ asteroid
content: Asteroid 99942 Apophis, known as the 'God of Chaos,' will make a close approach to Earth in April 2029. Although it poses no immediate threat, NASA plans to study it using the OSIRIS-APEX spacecraft. This event provides a rare opportunity for scientific research on near-Earth objects and their behaviors.
summary: Asteroid 99942 Apophis, known as the 'God of Chaos,' will make a close approach to Earth in April 2029. Although it poses no immediate threat, NASA plans to study it using the OSIRIS-APEX spacecraft. This event provides a rare opportunity for scientific research on near-Earth objects and their behaviors.

title: Rare coin hidden for decades by American family could fetch over $500,000
content: A rare 1975 dime inherited by three American sisters could fetch over $500,000 at auction. The coin is one of only two known dimes without a mint mark from the US Mint in San Francisco. Purchased in 1978 for $18,200, it was kept as a financial safety net for decades.
summary: A rare 1975 dime inherited by three American sisters could fetch over $500,000 at auction. The coin is one of only two known dimes without a mint mark from the US Mint in San Francisco. Purchased in 1978 for $18,200, it was kept as a financial safety net for decades.

title: Who is Joseph Couch? Man with military background behind Kentucky interstate shooting
content: Joseph A Couch, 32, is at the center of a manhunt after allegedly firing into vehicles on Interstate 75 in Kentucky, injuring five people. Authorities are combing a wooded area near London with drones and helicopters. Local schools have canceled classes as a precaution while the search persists.
summary: Joseph A Couch, 32, is at the center of a manhunt after allegedly firing into vehicles on Interstate 75 in Kentucky, injuring five people. Authorities are combing a wooded area near London with drones and helicopters. Local schools have canceled classes as a precaution while the search persists.

title: Man wakes to cockroach stuck in his throat: 'It had wings' - What happened next?
content: A 58-year-old man from Haikou, China, experienced an unusual stale odor and coughed up yellow sputum for three days before discovering a cockroach lodged in his trachea. A chest CT scan and bronchoscopy revealed the insect, which was then carefully extracted. The patient made a full recovery post-procedure.
summary: A 58-year-old man from Haikou, China, experienced an unusual stale odor and coughed up yellow sputum for three days before discovering a cockroach lodged in his trachea. A chest CT scan and bronchoscopy revealed the insect, which was then carefully extracted. The patient made a full recovery post-procedure.

title: ‘If you win Pennsylvania, you win the whole thing’: Trump prepares for debate with Harris
content: Donald Trump and Kamala Harris will face off in a high-stakes debate in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, a crucial swing state for the 2024 presidential election. Both candidates have made frequent visits to the state. Harris focuses on economic issues like prescription drug prices while Trump emphasizes economic strength and inflation concerns.
summary: Donald Trump and Kamala Harris will face off in a high-stakes debate in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, a crucial swing state for the 2024 presidential election. Both candidates have made frequent visits to the state. Harris focuses on economic issues like prescription drug prices while Trump emphasizes economic strength and inflation concerns.

title: Egyptian scientist starts petition to return Nefertiti bust
content: Former Egyptian antiquities minister Zahi Hawass has launched a petition urging Germany to return the bust of Queen Nefertiti, housed in Berlin's Neues Museum. Discovered by a German team in 1912 and taken to Europe in 1913, the bust is among three significant artifacts Hawass seeks to repatriate. He emphasises that only items removed illegally are targeted.
summary: Former Egyptian antiquities minister Zahi Hawass has launched a petition urging Germany to return the bust of Queen Nefertiti, housed in Berlin's Neues Museum. Discovered by a German team in 1912 and taken to Europe in 1913, the bust is among three significant artifacts Hawass seeks to repatriate. He emphasises that only items removed illegally are targeted.
